drupalNodeEvent.title: China's Leaders: From Mao to Now

field_speakers.processed: David Shambaugh (George Washington University), Alyssa Ayres (George Washington University)

field_organizers.processed: Elliott School of International Affairs, George Washington University, Sigur Center for Asian Studies

field_description.processed:
Join us for a talk on how modern China's five paramount leaders have shaped the country. David Shambaugh will be discussing his new book China's Leaders: From Mao to Now, the event will be moderated by the Dean of the Elliott School of International Affairs, Alyssa Ayres.
The event will be held virtually, with a lecture by the author, a discussion between the two speakers, and a moderated Q&A with the audience. Please send advance questions to the Elliott School Research team at esiaresearch@email.gwu.edu.
